properties.PRO_NAME: The National Zoo Washington DC
properties.DESC_ACT:
Start at 7am; end around 3pm.  Please only sign up if you are able to attend during those hours on IMPACT day.
 
Volunteer Work:  Group of volunteers will participate in over 20 projects including horticulture, painting, cleaning, and much much more. 

Attire/Tools:  No open toed shoes   

Non Profit Mission:  The National Zoo is a beautiful urban park offering family fun and excitement, stimulating education programs, and a peaceful place to enjoy nature. There is something new to discover on every visit.  We are the Nation's Zoo, demonstrating leadership in animal care, science, education, and sustainability. We provide the highest quality animal care. We advance research and scientific knowledge in conserving wildlife. We teach and inspire people to protect wildlife, natural resources, and habitats. We practice conservation leadership in all we do.

Important Notes: Please only sign up if you are willing to do manual labor.  The majority of the zoo projects require volunteers to paint, build, lift, and move throughout the zoo.  We also start work at the zoo around 7am and wrap up around 3pm.  Please only sign up if you are able to attend during those hours on IMPACT day. 

Next Steps: Once the roster is set, the Zoo Planning Team will send out communication E-mails and a survey to collect additional information (T-shirt sizes, food preference, project preference, etc.)

properties.PRO_NAME: Whitman-Walker Health Capital Pride Prep Whitman Walker Health
properties.DESC_ACT: A health clinic providing care, education, guidance and services to the LGBT community in the DMV area.  Each year the WW Health center needs assistance in assembling health kits and compiling handout information for the Capital Pride events to create awareness of the center and the mission of inclusive and diverse services for the LGBT community.

properties.PRO_NAME: Loudoun Therapeutic Riding Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT:
Loudoun Therapeutic Riding Foundation (LTRF) is a 501c-3 nonprofit organization dedicated to teaching horseback riding to children and adults with mental and physical handicaps.  LTRF also partners with Wounded Warriors and other organizations supporting veterans.  Through horseback riding, students at LTRF are able to boost their physical fitness, self-confidence, self-esteem, and achieve normalcy. Deloitte volunteers will assist LTRF coordinators and staff in general facilities maintenance (i.e. weed eating, trail clearing, fence repair) and other site improvement activities. 

One team will be responsible for trail clearing/brush removal, another team will paint fences, the third will repair fences and fence posts and demolishing an old paddock barn, and the final team will be responsible for weed whacking around paddocks where the horses live/graze.

properties.PRO_NAME: Germantown Boys and Girls Club Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Washington | Germantown Branch
properties.DESC_ACT:
For more than 70 years, Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro Atlanta (BGCMA) has been in the forefront of youth development, working with young people from disadvantaged economic, social and family circumstances. BGCMA enriches the lives of girls and boys that other youth agencies fail to reach. BGCMA is dedicated to ensuring that our community's young people, who are most in need of our help, have greater access to quality programs and services that provide promise, hope and opportunities to ensure that they may become productive adults. 1. Volunteers will be painting 
2. Volunteers will be doing landscaping
3. If Volunteers want to stay longer - they can assist with activities with the Children
properties.ORG_NAME: Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Washington | Germantown Branch

properties.PRO_NAME: The Closet of Greater Herndon
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Closet is a nonprofit thrift shop in the heart of historic downtown Herndon, Virginia.
 
The Closet was founded in 1974 by a handful of churches to assist low-income families by selling used clothing at nominal prices. Over the years, our mission has expanded and we have become a significant resource for the greater Herndon area. We continue to be a source of low-cost clothing and household necessities for families and individuals on a tight budget. We also give away clothing at no cost to truly needy individuals, and we use our profits to support worthwhile community programs. Items we are unable to sell are donated to needy communities in the western part of the state.
The Closet of Greater Herndon annually gives away nearly $55,000 worth of clothing and necessities to needy persons referred by authorized social service agencies, or one of our member congregations. Additionally, in just the past six years (2008-2013) we gave nearly $400,000 in direct cash donations to Herndon, Sterling and Western Fairfax area non profit community groups and programs. Since our founding in 1974 our cash grants to non profit groups, and for high school scholarships to five area secondary schools, are well in excess of $2,500,000. The majority of participants will be sorting through the Closet's backlog of donations of clothes, toys, games, electronics, and books.  Some participants may be asked to do minor cosmetic work around the facility.

properties.PRO_NAME: Community Read-in Day Raymond Education Campus
properties.DESC_ACT:
Raymond Education Campus is a PK-8th grade school with an enrollment of approximately 600 students.  The school serves a mostly low-income and minority population, with 99 percent of students on free or reduced price lunch plans and 96 percent of students who are either Black or Hispanic.  In addition, over one third of the school's students are English Language Learners.  The school seeks to empower its students to speak effectively, solve problems independently, demonstrate effective leadership skills, and become responsible citizens. 

In order to assist the school in this pursuit, the "Community Read-in Day" will be a school-wide event that celebrates the importance of literacy.  The morning's events will consist of volunteers having the choice to work with either lower or middle school students in classrooms.  Activities could include reading to students, helping students with literacy-based projects, or more!  After lunch, the second half of the day will be spent as a field day outside, with volunteers helping setup games and activities along with interacting with the students.

This is the second year for this event, and we hope you will join us in motivating these students about the importance of reading and writing in their lives!

properties.PRO_NAME: Northern Virginia Family Service (NVFS) Scrapbooking Day for Head Start NVFS: Scrapbooking Day for Head Start
properties.DESC_ACT:
Northern Virginia Family Service (NVFS) is a private, nonprofit community service organization dedicated to
helping individuals and families find new paths to self-reliance and brighter futures. NVFS works to improve the
lives of their clients through a number of service initiatives including early childhood development. This year's scrapbooking event involves creating scrapbooks for students graduating from NVFS' development program - Head Start. The event is a fun and interactive way to put creative skills to use and make scrapbooks that will be filled with photos that help to illustrate and commemorate the students' year in the program.

properties.PRO_NAME: March of Dimes - Maryland-National Capital Area Chapter
properties.DESC_ACT:
March of Dimes is a national non-profit with chapters nationwide.  The Maryland-National Capital Area Chapter serves the entire state of Maryland, Northern Virginia and Washington, D.C. 1. NICU Parent Care kits- Assemble bags that contain educational and support materials for families with a baby in the NICU.   
2. Sibling Care kits- Assemble bags that contain educational and support materials for siblings of a baby in the NICU.   
3. March for Babies Thank you notes- write handwritten thank you notes to the associates of Kmart, a March of Dime national sponsor, for their support and fundraising efforts.  
4. Safe sleep kits- Assemble kits with a sleep sack and educational information to teach and support families to put their baby in a safe sleep environment to decrease infant deaths
5. Scrap book pages- Use your creative talents to create pre-made scrap book pages families with a baby in the NICU can use. 
6. Golf packages- Assemble packets of tickets/information for golfers to use at the Golf for Babies event.
properties.ORG_NAME: March of Dimes - Maryland-National Capital Area Chapter

properties.PRO_NAME: Restoration Project at Autumnwood Pool Friends of Reston Community Projects/Reston Association
properties.DESC_ACT:
Friends of Reston is organized exclusively to aid Reston Association (RA) in performing its charitable, scientific, and educational purposes. Volunteers will receive a short training session from our Environmental Resource Supervisor in the identification of these plants, removal and control techniques. The training will include background information about the issues with invasive exotic plants.  Volunteers will be divided into five groups.
Group 1 (10 volunteers) Volunteers will help with the removal of a large invasive grass and spread a compost/soil mixture before replanting. 
Group 2 (15 volunteers) Volunteers will work with RA staff on upgrading planter beds and mulching the bed by the bike pad at the entrance of the pool. 
Group 3 (15 volunteers) Volunteers will work with RA staff to remove invasive plants; time permitting, volunteers will turflex the tot-lot. 
Group 4 (15 volunteers) Volunteers will help remove invasive honeysuckle vines and other invasive shrubs.
Group 5 (10 volunteers) Volunteers will remove invasive plants and install native shrubs in their place.
properties.ORG_NAME: Friends of Reston Community Projects/Reston Association

properties.PRO_NAME: Carpenter's Shelter Cooking & Spring Cleaning Carpenter's Shelter
properties.DESC_ACT: The Carpenter's Shelter is the largest homeless shelter in Northern Virginia, serving over 1,000 homeless and formerly homeless adults and children each year.  Their comprehensive continuum of care offers continuous services, aiding the chronically homeless and shelter residents through their transition back into independent living. One of the services they provide to their residents are home-cooked meals that different volunteer groups fund, cook and serve in the shelter's kitchen.  Deloitte currently has a group that volunteers once a month to plan, purchase groceries for, cook and serve lunch to the shelter residents. For IMPACT day, we will plan a lunch menu to  cook from scratch and serve to between 20 and 40 residents at the shelter.  Afterwards, aside from washing all the dishes we use to prepare the meal, we will also do a much needed thorough cleaning of the kitchen, pantries, and common area where the residents eat their meals.  This is a fun opportunity to cook with your colleagues and literally see the fruits of your labor through serving and interacting directly with the shelter residents who are always extremely appreciative and impressed with the home-cooked meals that Deloitte provides.

properties.PRO_NAME: Green Door Housing Beautification Green Door
properties.DESC_ACT: Founded in 1976, Green Door is one of the District's oldest, largest and highest rated behavioral health providers, which prepares men and women living with severe and persistent mental illnesses to work and live independently in DC. Green Door offers comprehensive, wrap-around services and programs. It also strives to educate the DC community about how people with mental illness can live successfully in and contribute to the economic stability of the area when they have access to appropriate services. One of the biggest steps that a client can take on his or her journey is moving into housing. Green Door supports its clients by linking those living with mental illness to affordable housing accommodations. This IMPACT Day, Deloitte volunteers will support Green Door's latest housing beautification project by refreshing the site with new paint and adding to the garden that surrounds the property.
properties.CAUSE: Community & Economic Development, Health & Human Services, Education

properties.PRO_NAME: Beautification Project - American Red Cross Arlington Office American Red Cross of the National Capital Region
properties.DESC_ACT:
The American Red Cross's mission is to prevent and alleviate human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.

For IMPACT Day 2015, The American Red Cross focuses on the beautification and restoration of the Red Cross Arlington Chapter property in North Arlington, VA. It will encompass landscaping efforts, painting exterior railings and benches, and painting a mural. The plan will be to re-mulch spaces at the front and edge of the property, plant new flowers and shrubs around the building, sand and paint various railings and benches, and fill in a pre-stenciled mural outside the building. The mural work will require team members who have painting skills and are willing to dedicate their time to this aspect of the project.
properties.ORG_NAME: American Red Cross of the National Capital Region

properties.PRO_NAME: Doorways for Women and Families
properties.DESC_ACT:
Doorways for Women and Families strives to end homelessness and family and intimate partner violence by offering safe shelter and housing, life changing support services, and community advocacy.
Volunteers will have the opportunity to participate in one of the following three ways at sub-sites located within close proximity to the main site in Arlington. 
1. Volunteers will garden, powerwash & stain fences and paint outdoor furniture at 2 domestic shelter facilities.
2. Volunteers will deep clean the internal kitchen and living spaces (playroom, living room, halls) as well as organize storage room in a domestic shelter facility. 
3. Volunteers will make runs to Goodwill with excess supply from the storage room.

properties.PRO_NAME: 2nd Annual Cancer Survivor's Day Washington DC Veterans Affairs Medical Center
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Washington DC Veterans Affairs Medical Center's mission is to respect and serve our Nation's Veterans by honoring them with excellent health care. 

For IMPACT Day 2015, Deloitte will support the VA Medical Center hosting its 2nd Annual Cancer Survivor's Day Event, and will provide other tasks associated with making Veterans feel welcomed and connected to their community. This support will involve four key components:

1) Support the Cancer Survivor's Day Event by helping Veteran participants register, move around, serving food, interacting with the Veterans, and providing other services as needed.
2) The opportunity to play games with and talk/listen to Veterans at the Center's Community Living Center.
3) Supporting the Veterans History Project.  Volunteers will help interview Veterans to capture their unique stories for recording and cataloging at the Library of Congress.
4) Providing administrative support to the VA Volunteer Office to include organization, cleanup, and filing.

Volunteers will have the opportunity to support a component of their choosing based on their interests.  
For all components, the key traits our volunteers should have are: compassion, the desire to listen/talk to and help Veterans, and a fundamental desire to interact with Veterans.
properties.ORG_NAME: Washington DC Veterans Affairs Medical Center

properties.PRO_NAME: Northern Virginia Family Service Food Warehouse Reorganization NVFS: Food Warehouse Reorganization
properties.DESC_ACT:
SERVE - "Hunger Resource Center"ù Transformation! 

SERVE, a program of NVFS, offers low-income families and individual's access to shelter, food, housing, health and more - moving them from crisis to stability. The SERVE Hunger Resource Center (HRC) needs your help transforming its facility. We will be cleaning, painting, and reorganizing the warehouse to create a clean, bright, and welcoming grocery store-like environment. Watch this video to understand the difference you will be making: https://www.commitchange.com/va/oakton/northern-virginia-family-service/campaigns/stand4serve. Bonus! This site is west of the beltway so you will be going against traffic! For metro users we will be arranging for pick up and drop off at the Vienna Metro!

properties.PRO_NAME: Field Day/Student Mentoring & Pack-up DC Public School - Powell Elementary
properties.DESC_ACT:
Powell Elementary School is a small, community-based school focused on academic success for all. They are the winners of the Fight for Children Rising Star Award and finalist for Dual Language School of the Year. In support of Powell Elementary, IBRG would like to create a volunteer event that includes the following components: 
"¢Field Day: We will work with DCPS - Powell's Physical Education teacher to lead games and activities for the children. This project provides the ability for local students to learn basic concepts of teamwork and for Deloitte staff to provide mentorship. 
"¢ Student Mentoring: We will partner with DCPS - Powell teachers to help students with their year-end portfolios. These portfolios help the student to reflect on the progress that they've made during the school year and demonstrate the skills that they have learned. This project provides the ability for local students to be mentored by local Deloitte professionals. 
"¢ Clean-up: DCPS will soon be going under renovation. This is an opportunity for Deloitte to help teachers pack up classrooms while students are out of the classroom (during field day).

properties.PRO_NAME: Catholic Charities - Mulumba House Catholic Charities
properties.DESC_ACT:
Catholic Charities assists individuals and families in need, especially those who are most vulnerable. Focusing on overcoming homelessness and substance abuse, the Mulumba House helps bridge the gap between homelessness and permanent housing. This is not an emergency shelter, but instead offers long-term housing and support services focusing on employment and sobriety through intensive case management including (1) substance abuse recovery, (2) counseling, (3) relapse prevention, (4) financial counseling, (5) employment counseling, and (6) interview referral and resume writing. 

IMPACT DAY 2015 will focus on beautification of the property. It will encompass painting the interior halls and common area, planting seedlings in vegetables in the garden and in the front of property, mulching the grounds, and general outdoor clean-up.
properties.CAUSE: Community & Economic Development, Civic & Public Affairs, Health & Human Services, Education

properties.PRO_NAME: LearnServe Accelerators II LearnServe Int'l
properties.DESC_ACT:
LearnServe Int'l provides afterschool and summer programs aimed at fostering social entrepreneurship in dc area students.  Students travel abroad to work with NGOs to solve global issues while also teaming with other students to solve local problems. 1)  Crowdsourcing/crowdfunding lessons learned:  discussion amongst Deloitte volunteers and Learnserve students of crowdsourcing issues
2)  Case Study:  Selection of a local issue that Learnserve students and Deloitte volunteers can trade experiences to try and solve.
3) Resume review:  Deloitte volunteers review and mentor Learnserve students in resume development and social networking

properties.PRO_NAME: The Women's Center Financial Counseling & Beautification The Women's Center
properties.DESC_ACT: The Women's Center is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization founded by Joan Parks and Peggy Lockhart in 1974. Initially, the Center's services focused mainly on career counseling and seminars. However, as social change continued to impact all aspects of women's lives and our community as a whole, the Center developed and expanded its services to meet those challenges. The Center has developed into a counseling & resource center for financial, career, legal and psychological needs of women, men and families. Financial counseling, cleaning, filing, systems management, painting, and beautification.

properties.PRO_NAME: WIN Gen Y Girls on the Run DC Skills-Based Volunteering Girls on the Run, DC
properties.DESC_ACT:
Girls on the Run is a youth development program that inspires girls to be happy, healthy, and confident through interactive lessons that integrate running. The DC chapter serves hundreds of 3rd-8th grade girls in the DC area, most of whom participate through scholarships.

For IMPACT Day 2015, Deloitte will be providing skills-based volunteering for Girls on the Run-DC. Our five work-streams will be: (1) developing coach training materials, (2) improving the inventory process (3) strengthening donor relationships, (4) identifying partnership and marketing opportunities, and (5) producing data-driven infographics and case studies.

properties.PRO_NAME: Global Kids-DC Sustainable Growth Plan Global Kids
properties.DESC_ACT:
Global Kids, Inc. is a nonprofit educational organization for global learning and youth development. It works to ensure that urban youth have the knowledge, skills, experiences and values they need to succeed in school, participate effectively in the democratic process, and achieve leadership in their communities and on the global stage.  Through Global Kids' programs, young people examine global issues, make local connections, and create change through peer education, social action, digital media, and service-learning, while receiving intensive support from GK staff.  Global Kids reaches over 14,000 youth and educators each year, while groundbreaking online programs reach millions more.  It operates in-school and out-of-school time programs in New York City and Washington, D.C. public schools and at its headquarters.  Representing the rich diversity of our world, many Global Kids participants, better known as the GK Leaders, attend low performing schools and live in neighborhoods whose ethnic groups are largely underrepresented academically, politically and professionally. 

The Impact Day activity will be a day-long facilitated strategy session that focuses on helping Global Kids-DC leadership determine how to best navigate the DC funding landscape and create a model for sustainable growth over the short, medium, and long-term. Prior to the facilitated session, Deloitte participants will have conducted initial analysis of Global Kids-DC's current state as well as the donor environment in Washington, DC and will have developed a preliminary list of possible approaches to be discussed with Global Kids-DC leadership.

The Impact Day activity will start with a goal setting session that will focus on working with Global Kids-DC leadership to articulate their goals over the short, medium, and long-term. Deloitte practitioners will work with the Global Kids staff to determine the fundraising needs associated with the organization's program growth goals.  Deloitte practitioners will also work with Global Kids-DC leadership to understand how their current fundraising mix impacts their programming capabilities. The Deloitte participants will also discuss the range of fundraising options with the client and will brainstorm additional development ideas as well as identify potential risks and options.  During the final session of the day, Deloitte practitioners will help Global Kids-DC leadership prioritize fundraising initiatives, creating a timeline that aligns to the organization's strategic short, medium, and long term goals. Additionally, the session will identify key areas for fundraising capacity development.

Throughout the day, graphic facilitators will capture the discussion in a graphic record that the organization can use as a guide and reference after the completion of the session.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: 641 S Street NW, Ste. 202B, Washington, DC 20001

properties.PRO_NAME: What If There Was An App for That? William O. Lockridge Community Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT:
Are you interested in making a difference in the lives of DC middle-school students? 

Hart and Williams Middle Schools in Southeast DC are committed to providing a quality education for their students, but the school and the students face many obstacles such as poverty, homelessness, overcrowded classrooms, and many others.  In partnership with the William O. Lockridge foundation, an organization focused on improving educational opportunities for students in Southeast DC, the "What If There Was An App For That" Impact Day project is an exciting opportunity for you to make a personal impact. 

The goal of the "What If There Was An App For That" project is to expose students to creative brainstorming and thinking differently about how to leverage technology to solve basic problems.   Deloitte volunteers will spend the day with a small group of students (5-7 students with 2 Deloitte practitioner) discussing and designing an IPAD mockup of an app to solve problems such as bullying, homework, lunch,  and school absences, community volunteering, etc.   No technical skills are required, just a bit of creative thinking and a desire to work with kids.  The IPAD mockup and colorful icons will be provided.

Last year the students, teachers and Deloitte volunteers were amazed at the fun, the level of student engagement, and the overall experience.  To quote one Deloitte volunteer "This was the most meaningful and powerful Impact Day project I've ever been involved in".
properties.ADDRESS_RA: Hart Middle School - 601 Mississippi Ave SE, Washington, DC 20032

properties.PRO_NAME: Schools Without Walls Impact Day School Without Walls High School
properties.DESC_ACT: Deloitte practitioners will work with School Without Walls (SWW) High School to provide skills-based workshops for SWW students covering various professional development topics. SWW is a public magnet high school of approximately 550 students grades 9-12, located on the campus of George Washington University. Students will rotate to different workshops throughout the day, ultimately gaining information and skills to help them succeed in their post-high school lives. Topics will include Social Media, Entrepreneurship, Leadership in a Diverse Workplace, Negotiation Strategies, and an interactive panel discussion with Deloitte practitioners.

properties.PRO_NAME: Making an IMPACT on military children with the Military Child Education Coalition (MCEC)
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Military Child and Education Coalitions' mission is to ensure inclusive, quality educational experiences for military-connected children affected by mobility, family separation, and transition. The mission is achieved through responsive and relevant support systems, and resources, and products; expanding outreach through engagement, advocacy, and partnerships; executing strategic communications; and building a sustainable, and financially sound organization.

For IMPACT Day 2015, Deloitte will assist MCEC with efforts focused on improving and updating critical infrastructure including plans of action to:  establish a mentorship and Ambassador program; refresh mission/vision statement and website; conduct a crowd source fundraising event; and develop a social media strategy.

properties.PRO_NAME: Professional Development Day: Business Chemistry and Framework to Becoming a Successful Supervisor NVFS: Professional Development Day
properties.DESC_ACT:
Northern Virginia Family Service (NVFS) is a private, nonprofit community service organization dedicated to helping individuals and families find new paths to self-reliance and brighter futures. NVFS works to improve the lives of our clients through eight core service initiatives: housing services, early childhood development, child placement services, health and mental health services, legal assistance, intervention and prevention and workforce development. 

NVFS specifically requested a two-part training in which Deloitte practitioners teach Business Chemistry and management and supervision skills to NVFS employees. There were will be two sessions (one before lunch and one after lunch). A trained Business Chemistry facilitator will help the group understand their Business Chemistry types. Various Managers and Senior Managers will discuss the traits of a successful supervisor. The topics include: coaching and mentoring, successful delegation, managing diversity, managing performance, and leading effectively.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: 10455 White Granite Drive, Suite 100, Oakton, VA 22124
properties.CAUSE: Community & Economic Development, Health & Human Services

properties.PRO_NAME: IMPACT DAY with StreetWise Partners StreetWise Partners
properties.DESC_ACT:
StreetWise Partners is an innovative social venture that aspires to provide all citizens with the skills and opportunities to become economically self-sufficient and achieve their full potential.  

On Impact Day, Deloitte will partner with StreetWise Partners to provide workplace skills, job search strategies and networking opportunities to low-income individuals from the D.C. metro area. 

During the day-long session, Deloitte practitioners will work one-on-one with individuals to identify their career goals, develop resumes and cover letters and build their professional network. Specific exercises will include workplace scenario-based trainings, mock informational interviews and resume reviews.  

By the end of the day, Deloitte practitioners will have provided professional skills and helped create work products to individuals who will better understand their career goals and how they can achieve them.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: 1615 L St. NW, Suite 1300, Washington DC

properties.PRO_NAME: United Way Worldwide
properties.DESC_ACT:
United Way Worldwide's mission is to improve lives by mobilizing the caring power of communities around the world to advance the common good. United Way Worldwide (UWW) envisions a world where all individuals and families achieve their human potential through education, income stability and healthy lives.

IMPACT Day 2015 at United Way Worldwide would involve sharing your knowledge and experience as Consultants, specifically in the areas of project planning and meeting facilitation. The team at UWW works with tens of thousands of companies and would like to learn new strategies on engaging stakeholders, facilitating meetings, and planning and scoping projects.

properties.PRO_NAME: School Justice Project
properties.DESC_ACT: School Justice Project (SJP) provides no-cost special education legal representation to court-involved youth ages 17-22 in DC. As education attorneys, they work with their clients to obtain quality education and transition services, both during incarceration and upon reentry. This year, we will be leading two strategy sessions. The first strategy session will be focused on analyzing the organization's goals and metrics. The organization has requested that we work in groups to visually analyze the impact that the organization has had on their clients and the change that the organization is bringing to the community. The next strategy session will be focused on the organization's leadership team and assessing the way in which the team works together. We will be working with each member of the team to understand how their working styles and preferences fit in with those of the rest of the team, which will ultimately allow the organization's leadership to work together to benefit the organization.

properties.PRO_NAME: Data Analytics Stars: Selecting Winners of City-Wide Teacher Analytics Challenge Raise DC
properties.DESC_ACT:
Raise DC is a local "collective impact organization"ù which sets city-wide targets for education, and encourages all stakeholders (from school districts, to charter schools, to after school programs) to work towards those goals to create tangible progress on cradle to career outcomes.  The organization recently applied for a grant from the Office of the State Superintendent for Education to provide incentive prizes to high-performing school districts and teachers.  The end goal of the impact day project will be to develop a strategy for Raise DC's competition to awards teachers for their use of data in the classroom.   To do so, Impact Day participants will be divided into groups and develop unique strategies, and will compete against each other to determine the most successful strategy for Raise DC.  In sum"îit will be a prize competition within a prize competition. 
1)	Practitioners will learn more about Raise DC's work and the impact it has had on the community.
2)	The pro bono team will provide background on our project with the organization, and how it's impacted the group.
3)	Practitioners will be provided a background on prize challenge design, and the $350k budget that Raise DC received to provide awards to its highest performing schools and teachers.
4)	Practitioners will then be split into teams, and will each develop their own strategies for Raise DC's teacher competition (the challenge within a challenge)
5)	At the end of the day, practitioners will present the results of their strategies, and the most creative/ insightful competition will win 
For more information on Raise DC and the Strive Together Partnership - an organization of 50+ communities across the country that are using a collective impact model to improve outcomes for youth--navigate to their website: www.raisedc.org/

properties.PRO_NAME: United Way of the National Capital Area
properties.DESC_ACT:
United Way of the National Capital Area is an alliance of charitable organizations that aims to create the opportunity for all members of the community to have a better life. UWNCA focuses on the building blocks of a good life - a quality education, financial stability for individuals and families, and good health. The organization works in partnership with more than 950 community organizations, focusing on Education, Income, and Health to enrich the lives of people throughout the National Capital Region and beyond.

On IMPACT Day, volunteers will:
1.	Conduct a facilitated session with United Way of the National Capital Area leadership and employees. 
2.	Participate in skills based volunteering by providing a learning series for teams within the organization.  Focus areas for the sessions will include: executive training, leadership development, employee management, problem solving skills, and the value of teamwork.
3.	Lead various team building exercises and icebreakers.
4.	Facilitate breakout sessions. 
5.	Participate in networking lunch with practitioners and United Way employees.
properties.ORG_NAME: United Way of the National Capital Area

properties.PRO_NAME: Fighting Miriam's Kitchen
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Challenge: Advocacy & Communications

The greatest challenge facing Miriam's Kitchen's - dedicated to ending chronic homelessness in the greater DC area - is growing its base of individual and organizational advocates.

For IMPACT Day 2015, Deloitte will:
Organize a volunteer group of practitioners to prepare, serve and clean-up after the Kitchen's daily breakfast, offering volunteers hands-on experience of how the organization uses food to build trust and eventually delivering shelter to the Capital's homeless.
Following the volunteer session, Deloitte will hold an off-site, skills-based session to discuss and help improve the Kitchen's advocacy initiatives.  Practitioners will lend subject matter expertise and thought leadership to Miriam's staff around strategic communications, to support MK's goals of improving its organizational advocacy for the homeless and developing an effective government relations strategy.

properties.PRO_NAME: Operation Hire Heroes USA Hire Heroes USA
properties.DESC_ACT: HHUSA provides transition assistance services and employment search assistance through specialized workshops. HHUSA will hold, with the support of Deloitte, a workshop in the Washington Area. A maximum of 25 Veterans will attend, along with 2-3 staff members from HHUSA and 3-5 Deloitte support volunteers. A networking event will be held following the workshop, HHUSA may expect Deloitte to invite 2-3 clients to attend.

properties.PRO_NAME: Urban Alliance: Strategic Communications and Outcome Planning Urban Alliance
properties.DESC_ACT:
Urban Alliance is the only year-long employment program for under-resourced high school seniors in Washington, D.C. and Baltimore, MD. Their goal is to give youth access to professional growth and experiences. The program prepares students for a life of work and self-sufficiency through paid internships, formal training, and mentorship.  Urban Alliance has received numerous accolades for their support. This IMPACT day site will be a half-day workshop for UA leadership and staff that will develop a marketing and communications strategy to commemorate UA's 20th anniversary in 2016. 
The 20th anniversary planning session will help UA consider strategies to promote the organization through messaging, strategic communications, and events.   Deloitte volunteers will facilitate a brainstorming exercise to help staff identify and evaluate specific strategies and develop a list of next steps.  The workshop will position UA to develop a fully flushed-out implementation plan for its 20th anniversary marketing initiative, including key partnerships, target audiences, and specific marketing strategies.

properties.PRO_NAME: Operation Student Veterans of America Student Veterans of America (SVA)
properties.DESC_ACT: Student Veterans of America (SVA) was founded by student veterans in 2008. SVA is a 501(c) (3) not-for-profit coalition of student veteran groups on college campuses nationwide. Student Veterans of America envisions a nation where all student veterans succeed in post-secondary programs and contribute to civilian society in meaningful ways. SVA provides the resources and support to do so through five major initiatives. TBD - The details are currently being discussed with SVA and will align to Deloitte's corporate citizenship vision as well as Deloitte's vision to support military veterans.

properties.PRO_NAME: Posse Scholar - Business and Soft Skills Workshop Posse Foundation D.C. Office
properties.DESC_ACT:
Posse is one of the most comprehensive and renowned college access and youth leadership development programs in the United States.
Founded in 1989, Posse identifies public high school students with extraordinary academic and leadership potential who may be overlooked by traditional college selection processes. Posse extends to these students the opportunity to pursue personal and academic excellence by placing them in supportive, multicultural teams"îPosses"îof 10 students. Posse partner colleges and universities award Posse Scholars four-year, full-tuition leadership scholarships. In order to develop crucial soft skills necessary for academic and career success, Posse scholars will navigate through a simulated day-in-the-life at Deloitte.  This interactive day will consist of Posse scholars interfacing (in small groups) with Deloitte staff to develop skills that they will utilize as scholars in high school, college, and in the work place.

The goal of the activities will be to develop their leadership and team building skills; ability to communicate; manage time effectively; and improve presentation skills.	

1. Posse scholars will be randomly divided into teams of 5-6.    1-2 Deloitte practitioners will work with each group to provide guidance and help facilitate the break-out sessions.  
 
2. Each group will receive a business case that will require the group to meet deadlines, collect requirements, attend or conduct interviews and client meetings, and outline presentations.

3. Students will be required to divide work evenly, multi-task, interact with positive and difficult clients, navigate an internal structure (partner approval), and develop and deliver a presentation put together with the assistance of Deloitte staff.

4. Deloitte and Posse leaders will critique and provide feedback at various milestones throughout the day so that they may capitalize on their strengths and recognize development areas that they can take with them going forward. 

5. We will provide roadblocks, physical relocation, difficult client meetings and other unexpected interruptions to help prepare scholars for various situations as they arise and how to compose/handle themselves.

6. We will enhance the interactive nature of the exercise by integrating conference calls, video, or online polls to connect attendees.

properties.PRO_NAME: Strategic Choices for ICMEC International Centre for Missing and Exploited Children
properties.DESC_ACT: The International Centre for Missing & Exploited Children (ICMEC) is an Alexandria, VA-based not-for-profit organization working worldwide to advance child protection and safeguard children from sexual abuse, exploitation and abduction. Through research-based advocacy, training, technical assistance and a collaborative approach to addressing these issues, ICMEC empowers and equips global partners - in government, academia, law enforcement, private industry and the NGO community - to make the world a safer place for children. ICMEC has an Asia-Pacific regional office based in Singapore, and a contractor working in Brazil to advance efforts in Latin America and the Caribbean. (While ICMEC is the sister organization of the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children, we are a separate, independent 501(c)(3) organization.) The project will consist of a Greenhouse facilitation session to shape a new partnership with the National Children's Advocacy Center.
properties.ORG_NAME: International Centre for Missing and Exploited Children

properties.PRO_NAME: J-FLAG Project Management Skills Building The Jamaica Forum for Lesbians, All-Sexuals and Gays (J-FLAG)
properties.DESC_ACT:
The nonprofit is Jamaica's only organization formally working to advocate for the LGBT and ally community, including in the fields of health and education, and working directly with LGBT populations in areas of most need. They work in an environment with extreme anti-gay cultural sentiment. We will work with J-FLAG's staff of 9 people to build project management and proposal development skills. This will be done through facilitated sessions from Deloitte practitioners with project management certifications and significant experience developing proposals. Activities include:
- group facilitated session on project management, including practical exercises
- group training on proposal development, including real examples
- practical advice on development of an actual J-FLAG grant proposal
properties.ORG_NAME: The Jamaica Forum for Lesbians, All-Sexuals and Gays (J-FLAG)
properties.CAUSE: Community & Economic Development, Health & Human Services, Civic & Public Affairs, Education

properties.PRO_NAME: National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund Personal and Professional Skills Development Webinar National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund (the Memorial Fund)
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Memorial Fund is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization headquartered in Washington, DC, dedicated to honoring and remembering the service and sacrifice of law enforcement officers in the United States. Overview: The IMPACT Day team supporting this project will host interactive webinars to current and former law enforcement officers and their families on various topics related to personal and professional development. Webinar topics are targeted towards providing participants the information, training, and tools they need to take care of themselves and their families financially, to successfully transition in and out of current and future careers, and achieve success in their desired career path. The topics are designed to bridge a gap between education and training participants want and need but are not readily available to them for a reasonable cost, or with the subject matter expertise Deloitte has to offer. 

Population demographics are expected to represent a diverse range of professional needs, from financial planning, to resume building, to preparing and planning their family members for higher education.

High-level description of work to be performed prior to IMPACT Day:
"¢ Create a survey to gather scope of interest and potential topics to discuss
"¢ Identify and secure subject matter experts (SMEs) based on identified webinar topics
"¢ Identify and secure facilitators, and support personnel
"¢ Create a registration site for interested parties to register for their topics of choice
"¢ Develop electronic and hardcopy marketing materials and webinar topic slide decks
"¢ Distribute marketing materials during Police Week, including webinar registration details
"¢ Analyze registrant details and schedule webinars in accordance with registrant time zones (e.g., schedule a morning and afternoon offering for resume building so both east and west coast registrants can attend and/or offer various webinar "tracks"ù occurring simultaneously so all parties have the option to participate in their topics of choice)
"¢ Schedule the webinar, multiple webinar "tracks"ù if needed, and secure Lync/conference line details
"¢ Disseminate webinar materials, WebEx details, and email notifications to registered participants; webinar materials will include hard copy documents for participants to follow in the event they are unable to access a computer during the webinar. 
"¢ Develop feedback surveys for each webinar topic

High-level description of work to be performed during and after IMPACT Day:
"¢ SMEs and IMPACT Day project team members will execute the webinars in accordance with selected training topics and set agenda. 
"¢ The project lead will confirm participants received webinar materials and redistribute draft copies as-needed.
"¢ At the close of the webinars the project lead will distribute feedback surveys to webinar participants.
"¢ The project team will evaluate the survey results and document an after-action plan.
properties.ORG_NAME: National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund (the Memorial Fund)

properties.PRO_NAME: City Blossoms Cardozo Senior High School Garden
properties.DESC_ACT:
City Blossoms was a recipient of the 2014 Mayor's Sustainability Award, an annual recognition of individuals, businesses, and organizations for their environmental leadership and contributions to the District become the greenest, healthiest, and most livable city possible. 

City Blossoms works with community-based organizations, neighborhood groups, and schools to create outdoor spaces where children and youth can use their creativity, intellect, and energy to grow and maintain fantastic and functioning gardens. City Blossoms' youth-driven gardens provide healthy activities and safe spaces to play, explore, and share food and space with others. Examples of activities that we have worked on in the past:
* Harvesting of herbs & veg
* Distribute harvest to Bread for the city
* Mulch, water and weed
* Paint structures.  Update and/or build structures (e.g. Mural wall, green roof for shed)

properties.PRO_NAME: Potomac River Clean-up The Ocean Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT:
Did you know that Rivers and streams provide 65% of our nation's drinking water? Millions of tons of trash end up in our nation's rivers and streams every year. And it's more than just an eyesore; it can contaminate your drinking water and threaten the life of all who depend on it.

For IMPACT Day 2015, The Potomac River Cleanup (PRC) project in the Georgetown, DC area is an opportunity to clean up the litter that is piling up in your local river - the great Potomac! It takes away from the beauty and safety of the waterway. You can help make your river or stream a safer, healthier place for wildlife and people.

Activities may include:
- Physically cleaning up the river waterway and around the river
- Learning how to identify and report unsanitary actions on the river
- Removing solid waste from shorelines (trash, tires, household appliances, etc.)
- Detangling plastic and other debris from riverine vegetation
- Documenting type/volume of trash for marketing/communication purposes
- Water sampling demonstration
- Observing wildlife 

Participating Non-Profits: The Ocean Foundation is a unique community foundation with a mission to support, strengthen, and promote those organizations dedicated to reversing the trend of destruction of ocean environments around the world.

properties.PRO_NAME: Beautifying Access Housing Inc. DC to support homeless veterans Access Housing Inc. DC
properties.DESC_ACT:
Access Housing is a nonprofit community-based organization dedicated to the principle that everyone, regardless of income or socioeconomic status, has a right to decent, safe, and affordable housing. AHI is the first program in the greater DC metro area to focus on serving and housing male and female veterans alike. With two main buildings located right in downtown DC, this organization is able to provide housing to as many as 98 veterans at a time. The wait list for veterans seeking to obtain a room at the center is extensive and to date, thousands of veterans have successfully returned to civilian life after going through AHI's program. 

About Access Housing's Services: The main goal of AHI is to provide housing and services to help homeless veterans assimilate back into a civilian lifestyle through assistance with employment opportunities and permanent housing.  AHI offers full meal service, a variety of counseling services (housing, job, mental health, Benefits, PTSD, and substance abuse), life skills classes, computer training, barber and beauty services, a food pantry, a VA run medical clinic, and more.

Your Volunteer Opportunity: Deloitte volunteers have the unique opportunity of giving back to the veterans who fearlessly fought for America's freedom. This particular project will be centered on bettering the lives of the homeless veterans who have sought shelter at Access Housing. The activities will be mostly sweat-equity based, including organizing the donations received, painting bedrooms, common areas and offices, cleaning service rooms such as the food pantry, barber shop, library, computer lab and dining hall, and tending to the community garden. Thank you for your interest, and we hope to see you there!

properties.PRO_NAME: Strong John Thomson Elementary School Field Day Strong John Thomson Elementary School

properties.PRO_NAME: Washington Parks and People Washington Parks and People (WPP)

WPP leads greening initiatives across the city -- massive land reclamation, native reforestation,  watershed restoration, public health and fitness programming, urban agriculture, and green job training -- to help revitalize once forgotten communities.

properties.PRO_NAME: NVTRP - horse farm facilities upkeep and maintenance activities Northern Virginia Therapeutic Riding Program (NVTRP)
properties.DESC_ACT: We are returning again this year to the Northern Virginia Therapeutic Riding Program (NVTRP) for Impact Day! NVTRP is a non-profit organization devoted to enriching the lives of children and adults, including programs for veterans, through the challenging, physically-active sport of horseback riding.  Our Impact Day activities will be conducted at the NVTRP farm in Clifton, VA.  This year's projects include fence building and painting, indoor and outdoor facilities cleaning and improvements, gardening, tack cleaning, and building game boards, signs and posts and other items to be used for enhanced skills based exercises in the riding ring. The physical appearance of the NVTRP facilities play a very important role in creating a positive environment and uplifting experience for those served by NVTRP's programs.  NVTRP is always very appreciative of the work Deloitte does for them on Impact Day, it really makes a difference.  We look forward to working with all those Deloitte volunteers who will join us at NVTRP for Impact Day this year. The retreat will offer a warm, home-like environment where families can relax and enjoy quality time together at no cost to them.  The grand opening is now scheduled for July 4th so there will be many last minute items we can do to help them get ready. properties.PRO_NAME: The Children's Inn at NIH
properties.DESC_ACT:
Children and families travel from all over the world to the National Institutes of Health (NIH) because conventional treatments have failed to have sufficient impact on their illnesses. Located in Bethesda, Maryland, NIH is the world's premier biomedical research facility. Children receive treatment for illnesses such as cancer, heart, lung, blood, bone and growth disorders, mental illnesses, and HIV infection.
The Inn gives kids a place to be kids for a while, instead of patients. At the end of the treatment day, they leave behind the IV drips, the needles, the nurses and doctors to return to The Inn and, most importantly, to the comforting presence of their families and caring staff and volunteers.
The overriding philosophy at The Children's Inn is that families make a difference in the lives of their sick children. To treat a patient effectively, the healthcare team must care for the family and child as one. The emotional comfort a family gives to a sick child and the mutual support among kids and families who share the same experience together are invaluable.

This year, volunteers will be taking part in two activities: (1) making Thoughtful Treasures, craft mailbox stuffers, for the children and families and (2) use the industry kitchen at the INN to cook frozen meals for the families to store and prepare when needed.  

The efforts on IMPACT Day will bring joy to the children for many days to come when they open their mailboxes and receive creative, thoughtful, and personal cards and crafts.  Prepared meals will help already stressed families to worry a little less about the meals they need to buy and cook so they can focus more energy on themselves and their loved ones.

properties.PRO_NAME: Main Street Child Development Center Field Day Main Street Child Development Center
properties.DESC_ACT:
In 1973, Main Street Child Development Center was founded to provide childcare for predominately low-income working families living in Fairfax County.  Each year, 125 children - ages 2 to 5 - are enrolled at Main Street to receive critical early learning services, enabling their parents to maintain full-time employment and to ensure their children are prepared for kindergarten.  Over the past 40 years, Main Street has prepared thousands of children for success in kindergarten, closed the achievement gap between low-income students and their peers, and increased parent engagement in children's lives. 

For IMPACT Day 2015, Deloitte volunteers will participate in field day events wtih the children of Main Street.  Each Deloitte volunteer will be assigned to, (and given the opportunity to pick before the event), a station to lead for the day.  The children will then rotate through the stations.  The stations are to include parachute games, simple motor skill games, face painting, hula hoops, limbo, obstacle courses, soccer drills, and more. 

This is sure to be a special day for the children to have fun, and run around with our volunteers!

properties.PRO_NAME: Lawyers Have Heart
properties.DESC_ACT:
Lawyers Have Heart, part of the American Heart Association, has, for 25 years, provided a way to engage lawyers and the legal community in events to raise money and awareness to help reduce the occurrence of cardiovascular disease and stroke. IMPACT Day activities will include:
-- packing t-shirts

-- other small projects

properties.DESC_ACT: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors. Volunteers will form close-knit groups and canvass specific areas in Alexandria to inform the residents about vital fire prevention, awareness, and planning information. properties.PRO_NAME: Child and Family Network Centers
properties.DESC_ACT: The Child and Family Network Centers' (CFNC) mission is to provide caring, high-quality, free early education and related services to at-risk children and their families in their own neighborhoods in order to prepare them for success in school and life. properties.PRO_NAME: For Love of Children
properties.DESC_ACT:
FLOC serves over 500 students in first grade through post-secondary in the Neighborhood Tutoring Program (a one-on-one, curriculum-based program to improve grade-level competency in math and reading) and Scholars Program (a college access and success program.)

This year our work at FLOC will include three activities: a focus group to develop a strategy for communicating a new scholarship program to students, an interview skills workshop with FLOC Scholars who are currently attending college, and an MS Excel/PowerPoint training class for FLOC staff.  All volunteers will assist with the interview skills workshop in the afternoon; the morning will be split between the other activities.

properties.PRO_NAME: College Success Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT:
About CSF:

The College Success Foundation - District of Columbia (CSF - DC) is a nonprofit founded in late 2006 to address the critically low college graduate rates of the students in the public and public charter schools of the District of Columbia, particularly in Wards 7 and 8. They provide a unique integrated system of supports and scholarships for underserved, low-income students to finish high school, graduate college and succeed in life.

Impact Day Overview:

In an effort to engage Achievers scholarship recipients in a strategic discussion about cultivating leadership, this years IMPACT DAY will focus on the facilitation of experiential workshops covering the following:
Cooperation - an act or instance of working or acting together for a common purpose or benefit; joint action
Communication - the ability to express thoughts, feelings, or information easily or effectively
Connectivity - the state or quality of being connected or connective.

Workshops:
Pressure Points (Cooperation) 
Pressure Points is one of the most challenging groups activities known to man. It will upset previously established group dynamics and force individuals to re-think their roles, within the larger group, while conducting this activity. How individuals cooperate with one another will determine the level of the collective success. Listening skills, helpfulness, honesty, and collaboration will be pushed to their limits. 

DiSC Personality Assessment (Communication) 
Experienced by over 40 Million people worldwide to reduce conflict and improve interpersonal communication, the DiSC activity will allow each participant an opportunity to discover their own unique way of communicating. The foundation of personal and professional success lies in understanding yourself, understanding others, and realizing the impact of personal behavior on others. 

A New Leaf (Connectivity) 
Far too often we build walls and operate in silos. Knowledge isn't passed on and necessary information isn't shared. Consequently, when there's a need for unity, it's a foreign notion because we haven't practiced being connected to the environment around us and the people within it. This activity will help us promote team work, develop trust, and will serve as a powerful metaphor for the need to practice new habits in our lives.

properties.PRO_NAME: Boys and Girls Club of Alexandria Boys and Girls Club of Alexandria, VA

properties.PRO_NAME: Samaritan Inns Mentoring and Beautification Samaritan Inns
properties.DESC_ACT:
Samaritan Inns began in 1985 with one transitional home in the heart of Washington, DC, with a capacity to house 9 men desiring to overcome homelessness and addictions. 

Over time, Samaritan Inns procured and completely renovated eight former crack houses across Washington, DC. Every year, these buildings are home to approximately 500 men and women as part of Samaritan Inns' unique Recovery Continuum that equips these individuals to reclaim their relationships, careers, and lives.

Today, Samaritan Inns' dedicated staff and volunteers continue to foster an environment of personal responsibility and loving respect for every man and woman who passes through Samaritan Inns' doors. Individuals arrive broken and emerge whole persons, capable parents, and contributing members of society. 
Activities include:

Beautification of 1 or more houses that residents live in while in the program

properties.PRO_NAME: Aiton Elementary Student Enrichment and Facility Beautification Aiton Elementary School
properties.DESC_ACT:
Aiton Elementary School's mission is to provide children with a rigorous learning environment that produces effort-driven, principled, and empathic students. 
For IMPACT Day 2015, the volunteers will focus on enriching the students' learning by presenting them with interactive lessons that highlight the curriculum they have studied over the past school year.  A sampling of activities that will be facilitated for levels Pre-K through 5th include: (1) math & science activities including: lava in a cup and jelly bean counting, (2) literature activities including: puppet theater and reading stories and answering flash card questions, and (3) sportsmanship activities including: signing a sportsmanship pledge and playing games like hopscotch and fireman. properties.PRO_NAME: Partnering with our Youth Anacostia Senior High School
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Partnering with our Youth program provides current high school students with invaluable information on the college application process as well as the benefits of obtaining a college degree. Deloitte practitioners at all levels are encouraged to attend the event and share their own college experiences and subsequent career journeys. Below is a detailed description and schedule of events:

8:30am -Arrive at Rosslyn Office 
8:45am -Depart Rosslyn Office 
9:15am -Arrive at Anacostia Senior High School 
9:20am -Set up (Stations will need to be set up with appropriate materials and signs before students arrive) 
10:15 am -(At this time, students will begin arriving and visiting each station.  Students have a "free"ù period and their lunch period between 10am - 2pm and have been encouraged to drop by the event. Each station will have materials that you can speak to.  Most importantly, feel free to speak from your own experience - how college has benefited you, what college is like, what resources were most helpful to you, etc. Every hour, Deloitte practitioners will have the opportunity to rotate stations and take on a different role; we will also rotate out for lunch breaks)
"¢	Station 1: Welcome/Sign In (2 practitioners)  
"¢	Station 2: Misconception #1 "There's No Value in a College Degree Anymore"ù (3-4 practitioners)
"¢	Station 3: Misconception #2 "I Can't Afford College"ù (3-4 practitioners)

"¢	Station 6: GWA College Materials (3-4 practitioners)

"¢	"Hallway Hype Team"ù (3 practitioners will be in the halls passing out flyers recruiting students to attend the event) 
2:00pm -Clean Up/Debrief

properties.PRO_NAME: Gearing Up for College Bound Achievement Prep
properties.DESC_ACT:
College Bound, Inc., a Washington, D.C. based, 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization, offers public and public charter school students in grades 8-12 academic enrichment and resources to prepare for and succeed in college. Founded in 1991, the organization offers tutoring, mentoring, ACT/SAT preparation, and academic and career guidance free-of-charge to assist students in the District of Columbia metropolitan area in meeting their post-secondary educational goals. For the first half of the day, the students will have the opportunity to work alongside Deloitte practitioners and participate in a local community beautification or team building project. Potential beautification projects will depend on the partner school needs; but could include gardening, disposing of trash, or painting a mural. Potential team building activities could include a team scavenger hunt with topics about college and college bound or a trivia game focused on college facts. The purpose of these projects is to engage the students in community-building efforts, and to demonstrate the importance of community service and working as a team. Colleges place high importance on service in the application process, and this will expose students to service in a fun, meaningful way. It will also help instill a sense of community involvement and awareness. 

The second half of the day will be comprised of classroom sessions. The sessions will expose 7th and 8th grade students to College Bound's organization, mission and vision. These students are College Bound's target market for enhancing and growing their high school program. We will utilize this time to encourage students to learn about themselves and their working styles through interactive sessions. Following the session, the students will discuss their aspirations and career goals to spark conversation around identifying strengths. This will help students recognize the importance of this awareness and the need to begin preparing now for the college application process, which will directly fuel College Bound recruitment efforts. The session will also incorporate an introduction to high school.

properties.PRO_NAME: Junior Achievement Finance Park
properties.DESC_ACT:
Junior Achievement provides financial literacy education experiences to students that are both unique and exciting, yet fully correlate with the requisite Standards of Learning. Learning about economics - whether it is a concept as simple as "wants and needs" or as complex as "modern international trade" - is a valuable and enriching experience for students. Prior to attending Finance Park, students are involved in a four week curriculum on budgeting and real-life economics. IMPACT Day volunteers will assist these students for the culminating event of their curriculum, a visit to Finance Park. Volunteers help students through the budgeting process by sharing their own life experiences, and also monitor the students to ensure their continued progress throughout the day.

properties.PRO_NAME: Atlas Corps Professional Skills Development Atlas Corps
properties.DESC_ACT:
Atlas Service Corps, Inc. (Atlas Corps), started in 2006, is an international network of nonprofit leaders and organizations that promotes innovation, cooperation, and solutions to address the world's 21st century challenges. Atlas' mission is to address critical social issues by developing leaders, strengthening organizations, and promoting innovation through an overseas fellowship of skilled nonprofit professionals. Profiled as a "best practice" in international exchange by the Brookings Institution and featured in the Washington Post as a model social entrepreneurship program, Atlas Corps engages leaders committed to the nonprofit sector in 12 to 18 month, professional fellowships at organizations to learn best practices, build organizational capacity, and return home to create a network of global changemakers. 

The Deloitte team aims to conduct structured presentations and panel group discussions to provide targeted skills development opportunities to Atlas Corps Fellows. These presentations/discussions would be broken out to different areas of the building or room and focus on the following topics:

properties.PRO_NAME: Military Spouse Skills Appreciation and Employment Readiness Workshops Army Community Service - Employment Readiness Program
properties.DESC_ACT:
Army Community Service (ACS) is an organization of the U.S. Army, staffed and housed on military bases across the country and around the globe.  ACS offers many programs and services that are designed to equip soldiers, DoD civilians, spouses and families with the support they need in facing the challenges of military life. Some ACS organizations, such as is the case with the ACS office at Ft. Belvoir, Virginia, also help with the challenges of transitioning to civilian life. One example is the Employment Readiness Program which helps prepare individuals to identify and develop marketable career skills for the current and future job market.
Services offered by ACS include: employment/career counseling, resume assistance, information and referral, job banks, job search workshops, job fairs, computers, printers, a resource library, and various outreach programs. Volunteers will support skills based learning workshops centered on employment readiness delivered in an interactive and hands-on format:
- Resume building
- Networking 
- Interviewing skills
- LinkedIn
- Building professional confidence

Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors (TAPS) offers compassionate care to all those grieving the death of a loved one serving in our Armed Forces. Since 1994, TAPS has provided comfort and hope 24 hours a day, seven days a week through a national peer support network and connection to grief resources, all at no cost to surviving families and loved ones. 

Activities Include:

Career Development Course - Understand the importance of networking, gain key interview tips and tricks, and translate prior military skills into applicable civilian skillsets for your resume

Community Service - Participate with local military non-profits (TAPS and partners) to build Father's Day care packages for wounded warriors at Walter Reed, assemble survivor resource kits for families of the fallen, or learn about escorting World War II veterans around DC memorials

Networking Session - Give veterans an opportunity to network with veterans at Deloitte; allow family members of veterans the chance to meet other members in the military

properties.DESC_ACT:
LCAC clients struggle to secure adequate employment to support their households. With the myriad of needs, LCAC has limited success in resume writing workshops. In the course of an average week, LCAC serves almost 50 military families through their food program. Many military members' spouses need to find gainful employment, but lack the focus and ability to create a strong resume.
Deloitte staff will work with military households to create or update resumes. The class will be held at LCAC's Education Center and will be limited to 6-8 persons per session. Several sessions will be offered throughout the day starting at 9:00am.

properties.PRO_NAME: DC Diaper Bank support DC Diaper Bank
properties.DESC_ACT:
DC Diaper Bank works to provide an adequate and reliable supply of diapers to babies, toddlers and their families in the Washington, DC metropolitan area. Modeled after successful diaper banks around the country, it provides diapers to social service organizations that are already helping families in need through comprehensive programs and services. Diaper banks using this model ensure that diapers are distributed to the families that need them the most and in the most effective way.
The cost of living in the DC metro area is the 8th highest in the country, with many families living in low-income families. The DC Diaper Bank provides an average of 75,000 diapers to more than 2,500 families a month. To date the DC Diaper Bank has donated over 1,000,000 diapers to families in need. 
For Impact Day 2015, Deloitte volunteers will help bundle diapers, sort food in the food pantry, sort baby clothes, prepare for distribution day to partners, beautify the center through gardening, and assist with onsite signage.

properties.PRO_NAME: Deloitte Student Consultant For A Day Boys Speak Out, Inc.
properties.DESC_ACT:
The main goal of the "Consultant For a Day"ù program is to expose KIPP Academy middle school students to the consulting profession. The students are engaged in a number of interactive activities with Deloitte practitioners. The activities are:
1. Students arrive and receive a quick welcome and introduction from Deloitte volunteers.
2. Students receive a tour of Deloitte office.
3. Deloitte partner speaks with students about professional development.
4. Deloitte volunteers demonstrate skills to be a successful consultant (educational and professional skills.)
5. Students break into small groups to participate in mini-case competition. Deloitte volunteers work with the small groups to facilitate discussion, problem solving, and presentation development.
6. Each student group presents their idea(s) regarding how to solve the problem to a group of Deloitte judges.
7. Deloitte judges present award to best student group presentation,
8. Students eat lunch and mingle with Deloitte consultants

Attire: Business Casual (Denim is acceptable.)
Duration: 6-7 hours
Advanced preparation: 1-2 conference calls to discuss roles and responsibilities.

properties.PRO_NAME: Operation Fischer House Foundation Fischer House Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT: Fisher House Foundation is best known for providing a network of comfort homes where military and veterans' families can stay at no cost while a loved one is receiving treatment. Families share a common kitchen, laundry facilities, a warm dining room and an inviting living room. Fisher House is a non-profit organization and since inception, the program has saved military and veterans' families an estimated $235 million in out of pocket costs for lodging and transportation. Impact day volunteers will have an opportunity to not only directly support Deloitte's National Veterans Strategy but also make an immediate impact within the Veteran Community in the Greater Washington Area, specifically the Fisher House in Bethesda. Volunteers will revamp current homes, provide landscaping support and provide additional on-site aid.

properties.PRO_NAME: College Summit
properties.DESC_ACT:
College Summit develops innovative solutions to transform the lives of low-income youth by connecting them to colleges and career opportunities. College Summit's Impact Day will be hosted at two sites.  Site 1 will be held in the Deloitte Rosslyn office and will consist of College Summit Staff participating in a Business Chemistry session that will facilitate strategic planning to promote better alignment between the regional and national organization. Volunteers will help manage logistics for the day, facilitate break-out sessions, and lead group activities. 
 
Site 2 will be held at Ballou High School in Washington, DC and will consist of 100 students from Ballou and Friendship High Schools who will work in teams to complete several challenge-based simulations that will ensure the student's success in a college setting.  Students will be judged on the decisions they make, quality, creativity, and completeness.  Volunteers will help facilitate the challenge simulations and choose a winner.

properties.PRO_NAME: BUILD DC Boot Camp BUILD DC
properties.DESC_ACT:
BUILD's mission is to engage talented, low-income students through high school to college success through entrepreneurship. The Deloitte volunteers will provide an all-day training session to a select group of BUILD DC students that are interested in developing their entrepreneurial skills. The following topics will be reviewed:

- Understanding and managing risk, with an exercise in mitigation and identifying risks
- Managing failure and developing resiliency to overcome difficulties

Volunteers will be expected to guide students through exercises and engage with students throughout the day. For more information on the organization, visit www.build.org.

properties.PRO_NAME: Crossroads Adaptive Athletic Alliance Strategic Communications Planning Crossroads Adaptive Athletic Alliance
properties.DESC_ACT:
The organization is formed exclusively for charitable and educational purposes, including development of an interactive, collaborative, searchable network to provide tips and best practices to adaptive athletes and their coaches nationwide.
 Crossroads Adaptive Athletic Alliance also educates and trains adaptive athletes to become adaptive coaches, helping to facilitate the reintegration of other permanently injured athletes back into both the sporting community and the local community at large through sport and competitive efforts. The proposed activity for Crossroads will be a skills-based volunteering initiative that concentrates on improving strategic communications with key stakeholders.

properties.PRO_NAME: Free the Slaves
properties.DESC_ACT: Free the Slaves (FTS) mission is to liberate slaves around the world and change the system that allows slavery to persist. For IMPACT Day 2015, the Deloitte team will focus on how FTS can strategically position itself within the anti-slavery space and optimize its contributions within the ecosystem of actors. In order to support these objectives and acknowledge key stakeholders, the team will work with FTS staff members to assemble donor packages and assist with other office logistics.

properties.PRO_NAME: Strategic Growth - Taking Critical Exposure to the Next Level Critical Exposure
properties.DESC_ACT: Critical Exposure (CE) is a nonprofit organization that trains youth to use photography and advocacy to make real change in their schools and communities. As a continuation of the existing work with Critical Exposure, a team of Deloitte volunteers will conduct a working session in data analysis and storytelling aligned with their short-term and long-term goals. This will allow CE to craft a story targeted towards major stakeholders and funders around the effectiveness of their programs.

properties.PRO_NAME: Education Pioneers Skills Based Workshop Education Pioneers - DC Metro Area
properties.DESC_ACT:
Education Pioneers attracts the top talent needed outside the classroom to help lead, manage, and transform our public education system. Education Pioneers partners with more than 43 organizations in the DC Metro Area, including school districts, charter school organizations, and education nonprofits, that are making tremendous strides on behalf of students, but are also hungry for business, management, and policy expertise, and often lack the capacity and resources to recruit cross-industry talent on their own.  By matching these organizations with the best and brightest emerging leaders from business, law, policy, and education, Education Pioneers offers Partner organizations an efficient, effective solution to secure top talent, accelerate strategic initiatives, and make quantum leaps forward. 
Deloitte Volunteers facilitate skills-based sessions providing consulting skills and approaches that Fellows can use during their summer placements. Prior to the event, teams of 2-5 volunteers will develop these skills-based sessions to enhance the Fellows' abilities to provide quality service to their organizations.

properties.PRO_NAME: After School All Star Advocacy, Expansion, and Kid Counseling! After School All Stars
properties.DESC_ACT:
After-School All-Stars¬†(ASAS) is a national non-profit organization that partners with schools across the United States to expand the learning day for low-income children. Its mission is to provide comprehensive after-school programs that keep children safe and help them achieve in school and in life. Youtube summary: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uw1S-XMtHsI 
¬†
For IMPACT Day 2015, ASA will focus on (1) Strategic planning for Advocacy in the DC area (2) Youth advisory board instruction/training  for nationally nominated youth advisors (7th and 8th graders), (3) Developing  expansion strategy as they look to reach more schools in DC, and (4) Career exploration opportunities with 7th and 8th graders.
