properties.DESC_ACT:
Bridges to Independence (b2i) works to give homeless individuals and families the support, shelter, counseling and employment training they need to regain self-sufficiency.  b2i provides transitional housing, case management, professional development, and youth programs. In addition to recently changing their name from Arlington Alexandria Coalition for the Homeless, b2i has also recently moved. This year's IMPACT Day will focus on 
1)	Being creative, innovative and handy: Organization and remodeling of the new space, including building and assembling shelves, creating wall art, sorting toys 
2)	Putting your tech saavy brain to the test: Technology 101 for both clients and staff, such as how to send a text message, how to use a GoogleDoc, or how to write an email
3)	Pinterest bonanza: the kids afterschool program needs a documented source of educational, fun after-school tasks, activities will include researching, documenting, and staging games or learning topics
Note: IMPACT Day will also include two closed projects: a metrics analysis project, as well as a video. If you'd like to participate in either of these, please email katmckenzie@deloitte.com.

properties.PRO_NAME: Boys & Girls Club Greater Washington All Hands Meeting Boys & Girls Club of Greater Washington (BGCGW)
properties.DESC_ACT:
BGCGW's 12 sites"îcovering a territory of 75 miles that stretches from Manassas to Germantown"îserve as safe havens for our members. The clubs are open when schools are not, and provide a safe, comfortable, and fun alternative to youth who would otherwise be home alone or on the street. Over 1,300 youth attend the Clubs for activities every day, to see their friends, and to spend time with positive and encouraging adults. Clubs are open after school on weekdays. Some have Saturday hours, and many offer full days during school holidays and summers. Clubs welcome every child, adolescent, or teenager for a nominal annual membership fee, but will not turn any child away for inability to pay. Strategic Planning:
- Natural follow-up to last year's IMPACT Day All Hands Meeting
- Review gaps identified in last year's session and action plans that were developed
- Discuss progress of filling these gaps throughout the past year
- Propose new strategic goals for the upcoming year 

Professional Development:
- Review Insights Discovery Profile Assessments (profile assessment similar to Business Chemistry) from prior year
- Insights Discovery / Business Chemistry activity breakout sessions with BGCGW leaders (HQ and clubs) - hosted by volunteers and Deloitte Business Chemistry representatives 
- Incorporate best practices for working together into everyday work setting
properties.ORG_NAME: Boys & Girls Club of Greater Washington (BGCGW)

properties.PRO_NAME: Edu-Futuro: Empowering Hispanic Community through Career Mentorship Edu-Futuro
properties.DESC_ACT:
Edu-Futuro supports and empowers Latino families through educational programs and leadership development while teaching the broader community about the Latin American culture. The project will focus on providing valuable academic and career skills based workshops in a one-on-one format and within a group setting. This project will target 60-80 Hispanic first-generation youth and young adults that fall into three groups of participants:
"¢	High School students enrolled in Arlington County Public Schools
"¢	Students currently enrolled in local universities or community colleges
"¢	Recent college graduates
Participants will be given an agenda based on their group type and targeted skill sets. Skills-based workshops for high school students will be organized to provide guidance on pursuing a college education, learning about financial aid, and essay-writing. Current college students will complete workshops on career exploration, resume-writing, and interviewing. Recent college graduates will be offered resume-writing, interview, and networking workshops. 
Although there are group-specific workshops, many of the topics overlap and will be tailored to meet the participant's academic or career level. In addition, a panel of Deloitte professionals will be available to all participants.

properties.PRO_NAME: Best Buddies International
properties.DESC_ACT:
Best Buddies is an international nonprofit dedicated to creating opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, and leadership development for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Best Buddies Ambassador Training is a public speaking and leadership development training workshop for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Deloitte volunteers will be paired up one-on-one with a Best Buddies participant to serve as a speech coach for the training. Speech coaches assist Best Buddies participants with the following tasks:
"¢	Understanding the elements of a speech
"¢	Drafting and writing a speech
"¢	Practicing speech delivery
"¢	Delivering a speech to an audience

The agenda will likely include the following activities:
"¢	Welcome and introductions (8:30-9:00am)
"¢	Overview of writing a speech and public speaking (9:00am-9:30am)
"¢	Writing the introduction (9:30am-10:00am)
"¢	Writing the body (10:00am-11:00am)
"¢	Writing the conclusion (11:00am-11:30am)
"¢	Practice delivering speech (11:30am-12:00pm)
"¢	Lunch (12:00pm-12:45pm)
"¢	Speeches from Buddy participants (12:45pm-3:00pm)

properties.PRO_NAME: AID Atlanta
properties.DESC_ACT:
AID Atlanta, Inc. has been saving and transforming lives since its inception in 1982. The agency was founded as a "grass-roots" response to the devastating and fatal impact HIV/AIDS was having on the Atlanta community. AID Atlanta quickly began expanding to offer a broad range of services and has since grown to be the Southeast's oldest, largest, most comprehensive AIDS Service Organization. The mission of AID Atlanta is to reduce new HIV infections and improve the quality of life of its members and the community by breaking barriers and building community.

We will be helping the organization by providing presentations on time management and leadership to managers in the organization. The other project will involve landscaping and painting activities at the headquarters in midtown.

properties.PRO_NAME: Atlanta Community Food Bank - Food Well Alliance
properties.DESC_ACT:
Food Well Alliance focuses on established community and educational garden infrastructure projects including irrigation systems, water catchment systems, compost bins, repairing/installing raised beds, installing a fences, gates and signs. 

The First Existentialist Community Garden of Atlanta has been in existence for many years but was recently upgraded in partnership with Primavera Pre-School.
Primavera Pre-School students make use of the garden as part of their comprehensive educational experience. The Pre-school uses a "food as curriculum" approach, by growing food in the community garden that can be used in child-friendly food prep, as well as part of the Pre-school's daily organic home-style lunches. The garden not only helps to beautify the urban community but allows the next generations to be exposed to the positive impacts of gardening at a young age.

The project will expand the educational focus of the garden for the Pre-school and Sunday School children and to replace the rotting frames around the existing beds. The rotting frames no longer contain the soil and are also a safety hazard for young children.
properties.ORG_NAME: Atlanta Community Food Bank - Food Well Alliance

properties.PRO_NAME: Atlanta Ronald McDonald House Charities
properties.DESC_ACT:
ARMHC provides housing for families who have children receiving inpatient care at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta Eggleston. The housing is provided free for the families and they provide breakfast and dinner, allowing the families to visit their child at the hospital during the day. 

We will be cooking breakfast for the families who have children at the hospital. Along with breakfast, we'll prepare baked goods and casseroles to leave for the families to eat when they return from the hospital. Time permitting, we will assemble gift baskets that are given to families when they check into the house. Gift basket items include toiletries and small toys to welcome them to the home.

properties.PRO_NAME: Books for Africa 2015
properties.DESC_ACT:
Books For Africa. A simple name for an organization with a simple mission. They collect, sort, ship, and distribute books to students of all ages in Africa. Their goal: to end the book famine in Africa.

Books For Africa remains the largest shipper of donated text and library books to the African continent, shipping over 30 million books to 49 different countries since 1988. In 2012, we shipped 2.2 million books valued at $28.3 million to 22 African countries, with an additional 616 computers and 15 brand new law libraries

properties.PRO_NAME: East Atlanta Kids Club
properties.DESC_ACT: East Atlanta Kids Club is a nonprofit, out-of-school tutoring, mentoring and enrichment program for under-resourced girls and boys ages 7 to 17. The club was formed in 1998 by local residents hoping to give youth, who otherwise have limited after-school and summertime options, a safe and stimulating place to play, to learn and to express themselves under the supervision of caring adults.

properties.PRO_NAME: Girl Scouts of Greater Atlanta
properties.DESC_ACT:
Girl Scouts of the USA is the world's preeminent organization dedicated solely to girlsóall girlsówhere, in an accepting and nurturing environment, girls build character and skills for success in the real world. In partnership with committed adult volunteers, girls develop qualities that will serve them all their lives, like leadership, strong values, social conscience, and conviction about their own potential and self-worth.
Girl Scouts of Greater Atlanta, Inc. serves approximately 42,000 girls and over 18,000 adult members in 34 counties in the greater metropolitan Atlanta area, northwest Georgia and Polk County, TN

properties.PRO_NAME: Habitat for Humanity Restore
properties.DESC_ACT: The Atlanta Retail Community has organized a great opportunity for you to get involved in a local, non-profit retailer! Leverage your retail skills to help the Habitat for Humanity Restore with backroom and inventory management, pricing strategy, and overall merchandising.

properties.PRO_NAME: Hire Heroes
properties.DESC_ACT:
Many veterans struggle to market themselves effectively. Employers receive resumes every day from veterans, but hiring managers have trouble understanding the military lingo and identifying transferable skills. There are also stigmas associated with veterans. Some employers believe Iraq and Afghanistan veterans are not good job candidates due to physical or psychological disabilities. Our nation has invested considerable resources into training its military service members, only to "leave money on the table" when those members become unemployed veterans.

Hire Heroes USA believes a solution to the problem of is to train job-seeking veterans to find and attain employment, while creating opportunities for employers to meet those veterans. Through the intake process and workshops, Hire Heroes will provide personalized employment assistance to US military veterans and their spouses by managing realistic expectations, training in self-marketing, and identifying transferable skills from the military to private sector. Simply, Hire Heroes helps bridge the gap between Corporate America and Veterans.

Our project will help Hire Heroes in their mission by providing them with a venue to share their content while also providing Deloitte practitioners the opportunity to help veterans through: 1) Brand training, 2) Resume Assistance, 3) Mock Interviews, 4) Networking with Deloitte practitioners and Deloitte client and partners as well.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: Deloitte Office - 191 Peachtree Street, NE, Atlanta GA 30303

properties.PRO_NAME: Junior Achievement of Georgia Inc
properties.DESC_ACT:
Since 1949, Junior Achievement (JA) of Georgia has inspired and prepared young people to succeed. With more than 7,000 volunteers, JA's programs bridge the business and education communities with lessons that empower young people to own their future economic success. During the 2012-2013, JA of Georgia served more than 163,000 K-12th grade students throughout the state. 

Located inside of Junior Achievements Chick-fil-A Foundation Discovery Center, JA BizTown and JA Finance Park provide more than 30,000 metro Atlanta middle school students with a dynamic learning experience designed to enhance financial literacy and build skills for professional success. By volunteering and supporting the entire day at the Discovery Center. We will help continue the relationship with the students of the JA Fellows program during the Summer, and support continued focus on financial and real life understanding for Middle / High School students. We would also alleviate the need for the organization to find volunteers who can double as successful and diverse mentors (for the day) for the students. 

Our project will focus on two specific areas: JA Finance Park and Inventory Management (Skills-based). 

JA Finance Park allows students to experience their personal financial futures first-hand. Upon entering the center, students receive a life situation with job, income, education, and family scenarios. Based on their adult persona, students visit businesses in the simulation to gather information to make wise financial decisions, such as managing a household budget, using banking services and determining investment options. For the Finance Park task in the Discovery Center, a small pre-training will be required, but can be delivered during the morning before the students arrive. If any additional training is required, we would do it virtually. 

For the Skills-based Inventory Management project, volunteers will provide JA guidance in how to better manage their inventory; which includes, developing a tool to help project usage and organizing their current inventory space to improve flow. Volunteers would need to work together for conceptual planning the week of Impact Day virtually.

properties.PRO_NAME: KIPP Ways Academy
properties.DESC_ACT:
It is the mission of WAYS Academy to prepare students for top quality high schools, colleges, and the competitive world beyond by instilling in each student a commitment to scholarship, teamwork, integrity, and other "WAYS to success."

At KIPP, we will be helping the school prepare for the upcoming school year by painting the classrooms, conducting landscaping projects, and overall clutter clean up

properties.PRO_NAME: Kirkwood Neighbors Organization and Friends of Clay Cemetery
properties.DESC_ACT: The cemetery evolved from a family burial ground in the mid 1800's to a burial ground for economically stressed families during the collapse of the Southern economy in the 1920's and 1930's. These changes are represented by a shift in markers from plain tablet stones to expensive Victorian and Edwardian gravestones to the homemade cement gravestones and rock markers of very low income burial practices. The cemetery's history accurately illustrates the economic and social path of Kirkwood and Atlanta in DeKalb during the 19th and early 20th Centuries.
properties.ORG_NAME: Kirkwood Neighbors Organization and Friends of Clay Cemetery

properties.PRO_NAME: Latin American Association (LAA)
properties.DESC_ACT:
The Latin American Association (LAA) helps Latino families achieve their aspirations for their academic, social, and economic advancement. LAA was established in 1972 to serve Atlanta's then-emerging Latino population and has grown to become the region's leading agency representing Latino issues. Their goal is to help Latinos achieve self-sufficiency, put down roots, build a better life for themselves and their families, and contribute to strong, thriving communities. LAA serves more than 44,000 individuals annually through direct programs and integrated community partnerships that focus on youth academic achievement, education, and services to families with urgent needs. 

We will be reviewing resumes, performing mock interviews, and providing constructive criticism to participants about interviewing and resume writing. This skill-based community service event is the perfect way to utilize your professional skills and truly make a difference by helping others better prepared for finding their next job.

properties.PRO_NAME: National Kidney Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT:
Many non-profit organizations face the same issues as our business clients, but lack the resources or in-house talent to adequately address those challenges. Scope Coach will address this problem by providing the participating non-profits with access to a talented Deloitte team that can help them make significant progress vis-‡-vis their most pressing issue areas. 

To help the National Kidney Foundation, we will be performing the following work in an intensive, one-day session:

- Needs Assessment: Review of the needs assessment submitted by the non-profit, validate the challenge to be addressed, hone in on key pain points and opportunities

- Brainstorm Solutions: Creative brainstorming exercise to generate ideas, using innovation techniques; narrow down the list of ideas and prioritize in order to select a project

- Define and Scope: Define key project components against which the client can deliver a pro bono project; identify workstreams, resource needs, approximate timeframe and key deliverables

properties.PRO_NAME: National Multiple Sclerosis Society
properties.DESC_ACT:
Multiple sclerosis (MS) is an unpredictable, often disabling disease of the central nervous system that disrupts the flow of information within the brain, and between the brain and body. The cause of MS is still unknown ñ scientists believe the disease is triggered by as-yet-unidentified environmental factor(s) in a person who is genetically predisposed to respond.

Many who are afflicted with MS are no longer able to handle basic household maintenance due to symptoms of the disease and/or having lost their mobility.

Every year, the MS Society organizes 1 day to go to the homes of those in need (based on a selection process) with volunteers and help them get their home back in order which provides them with a fresh and positive outlook since they are unable to perform these tasks themselves. Unfortunately, not all requests submitted can be honored due to volume, so this project will focus on 2 deserving homeowners who were not able to be chosen for the National MS Service Day in March - and help perform basic household projects and maintenance.

Home 1 - Atlanta - Interior painting, replace damaged sheetrock, seal deck, basic yard clean up, basic home clean up

Home 2 - Hapeville - Pressure washing home, basic yard clean up, basic home clean up, replace weather stripping, clean and organize garage

properties.DESC_ACT:
Save The Horses.org was founded in 1998 by Cheryl Flanagan, who has devoted her life to rescuing abused / neglected horses and those that are discarded by race tracks, headed for slaughter, because they can no longer win or breed. Often times horses who have suffered a trauma, come to the farm, terrified of humans. It takes many volunteer hours of loving patience to relieve the psychological scars and physical wounds that have been inflicted.

Not only do they rehabilitate horses, they offer therapeutic programs that connect horses and humans thereby facilitating a special bond between rescued horses and children that have been adopted or are currently in foster care; all in a physically and emotionally safe environment. They also offer regular equine education to the general public.

They have 108 horses to feed, water, bath, exercise and medicate plus 90 acres of fenced pasture to maintain, on a farm in Cumming, GA. Save The Horses is funded exclusively by donations / fund raising and they receive no government assistance. They exist solely from the generosity of volunteers. This is a no-kill shelter and they are definitely deserving of our help and consideration

properties.PRO_NAME: Stop Hunger Now
properties.DESC_ACT:
Stop Hunger Now is an international hunger relief agency that has been fulfilling its commitment to end hunger for more than 15 years. Since 1998, the organization has coordinated the distribution of food and other lifesaving aid to children and families in countries all over the world.

The assembly process combines rice, soy, dehydrated vegetables and a flavoring mix including 21 essential vitamins and minerals into small meal packages. These meal packages are shipped around the world to support school feeding programs and crisis relief. The food stores easily, transports quickly and has a shelf-life of two years

The event will be a high energy, fun time with music and celebration.

properties.PRO_NAME: United Methodist Children's Home
properties.DESC_ACT:
The United Methodist Children's Home was established in 1871 to care for children orphaned during the Civil War. Over the years, the Children's Home began offering additional services to children, teens and families, including Foster Care, Adoption, Independent Living, Transitional Living, Family Housing, Family Counseling, Parenting Classes, Financial Aid, and Higher Education Assistance.

The United Methodist Children's Home of the North Georgia Conference is a ministry to hurting children and families. All of its services are aimed at preventing the breakup of families, restoring and healing separated families, or teaching teens and young adults how to create successful and meaningful lives for their own future families. The UMCH wants all of its youth and families to know they have the power to overcome their past and reach a brighter future.

This is our fifth year partnering with UMCH. The service projects completed by the staff of Deloitte will help by improving the presentation and maintenance of the interior and exterior of several of the buildings and cottages that have provided a safe haven and assistance to thousands of children over the past century. With Deloitte, many hands make light work, allowing us to complete projects in a day that would typically take weeks and months to finish.

properties.PRO_NAME: Usher's New Look Foundation
properties.DESC_ACT: Usher's New Look is a non-profit organization dedicated to engaging disconnected youth in finding a path to leadership and career. The Deloitte team will facilitate a skills based training session to help the New Look youth develop and enhance their public speaking skills.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: Deloitte Office - 191 Peachtree Street, NE, Atlanta GA 30303

properties.PRO_NAME: Wellspring Living
properties.DESC_ACT: Wellspring Living has two programs. One program securely houses and serves girls who are survivors of DMST (Domestic Minor Sex Trafficking), with a focus on trauma therapy, education, life skills, and confidence. The other program is a residential program for survivors of DMST (Domestic Minor Sex Trafficking) offering continued education, therapy, and life skills training to build independence. We will be helping to beautify the residential home for the survivors of these programs on site. These homes play an incredible role in the rehabilitation of the women and children; this is an empowering way to give back to a community that is in much need of our assistance.

properties.PRO_NAME: Wesley Woods
properties.DESC_ACT:
Wesley Woods provides affordable housing to lower income, elderly adults. Wesley Woods also raises research money for Emory University Medical Center for Alzheimer's and Parkinson's diseases. 
The project this year will have several components. The first component will include building several garden areas where residents and grow edible plants.

The second component will include working with the residents on internet safety including basis set-up and understanding of email, google docs and social media basis. 

Finally, we will provider general landscaping and clean-up of the grounds.
properties.ADDRESS_RA: Branan Towers - 1200 Glenwood Avenue, SE , Atlanta GA 30029

properties.DESC_ACT: Help to beautify the Zoo which supports membership and maintains accreditation.
